meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great force.
meanings.sent1: He was clobbering the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was clobbering his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was clobbering the squeaky toy all around the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm was clobbering the coast with relentless waves.
meanings.sent5: The chef was clobbering the garlic to release its flavor into the dish.

meanings.definition: To defeat decisively in a competition or argument.
meanings.sent1: The team clobbered their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: She clobbered her opponent in the debate with strong arguments.
meanings.sent3: The students clobbered the quiz, surprising their teacher with perfect scores.
meanings.sent4: The new technology clobbered the old methods in efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The superhero clobbered the villain, saving the city from destruction.
